channel.title: CVE Feed for JFrog -- Artifactory
channel.description: The latest CVEs for JFrog -- Artifactory

item.title: CVE-2021-45730|2024-08-04T04:47:02.171Z -- jfrog -- artifactory
item.description: JFrog Artifactory prior to 7.31.10, is vulnerable to Broken Access Control where a Project Admin is able to create, edit and delete Repository Layouts while Repository Layouts configuration should only be available for Platform Administrators.

item.title: CVE-2021-41834|2024-08-04T03:22:24.943Z -- jfrog -- artifactory
item.description: JFrog Artifactory prior to version 7.28.0 and 6.23.38, is vulnerable to Broken Access Control, the copy functionality can be used by a low-privileged user to read and copy any artifact that exists in the Artifactory deployment due to improper permissions validation.

item.title: CVE-2024-4142|2024-08-01T20:33:52.579Z -- jfrog -- artifactory
item.description:
An Improper input validation vulnerability that could potentially lead to privilege escalation was discovered in JFrog Artifactory.
Due to this vulnerability, users with low privileges may gain administrative access to the system.
This issue can also be exploited in Artifactory platforms with anonymous access enabled.

item.title: CVE-2024-2248|2024-07-29T13:17:15.300Z -- jfrog -- artifactory
item.description: A Header Injection vulnerability in the JFrog platform in versions below 7.85.0 (SaaS) and 7.84.7 (Self-Hosted) may allow threat actors to take over the end user's account when clicking on a specially crafted URL sent to the victim’s user email.

item.title: CVE-2024-2247|2024-06-04T17:29:05.203Z -- jfrog -- artifactory
item.description: JFrog Artifactory versions below 7.77.7, 7.82.1, are vulnerable to DOM-based cross-site scripting due to improper handling of the import override mechanism.

item.title: CVE-2024-2248|2024-05-15T13:13:29.213Z -- jfrog -- artifactory
item.description: A Header Injection vulnerability in the JFrog platform in versions below 7.85.0 (SaaS) and 7.84.7 (Self-Hosted) may allow threat actors to take over the end user's account when clicking on a specially crafted URL sent to the victim’s user email.

item.title: CVE-2024-4142|2024-06-04T17:55:28.563Z -- jfrog -- artifactory
item.description:
An Improper input validation vulnerability that could potentially lead to privilege escalation was discovered in JFrog Artifactory.
Due to this vulnerability, users with low privileges may gain administrative access to the system.
This issue can also be exploited in Artifactory platforms with anonymous access enabled.

item.title: CVE-2023-42661|2024-03-07T13:56:38.162Z -- jfrog -- artifactory
item.description: JFrog Artifactory prior to version 7.76.2 is vulnerable to Arbitrary File Write of untrusted data, which may lead to DoS or Remote Code Execution when a specially crafted series of requests is sent by an authenticated user. This is due to insufficient validation of artifacts.

item.title: CVE-2023-42509|2024-03-07T14:07:09.944Z -- jfrog -- artifactory
item.description: JFrog Artifactory later than version 7.17.4 but prior to version 7.77.0 is vulnerable to an issue whereby a sequence of improperly handled exceptions in repository configuration initialization steps may lead to exposure of sensitive data.

item.title: CVE-2023-42662|2024-03-07T08:29:03.112Z -- jfrog -- artifactory
item.description: JFrog Artifactory versions 7.59 and above, but below 7.59.18, 7.63.18, 7.68.19, 7.71.8 are vulnerable to an issue whereby user interaction with specially crafted URLs could lead to exposure of user access tokens due to improper handling of the CLI / IDE browser based SSO integration.

item.title: CVE-2024-2247|2024-08-01T19:03:39.114Z -- jfrog -- artifactory
item.description: JFrog Artifactory versions below 7.77.7, 7.82.1, are vulnerable to DOM-based cross-site scripting due to improper handling of the import override mechanism.

item.title: CVE-2024-2248|2024-08-01T19:03:39.335Z -- jfrog -- artifactory
item.description: A Header Injection vulnerability in the JFrog platform in versions below 7.85.0 (SaaS) and 7.84.7 (Self-Hosted) may allow threat actors to take over the end user's account when clicking on a specially crafted URL sent to the victim’s user email.

item.title: CVE-2023-42661|2024-08-02T19:23:40.149Z -- jfrog -- artifactory
item.description: JFrog Artifactory prior to version 7.76.2 is vulnerable to Arbitrary File Write of untrusted data, which may lead to DoS or Remote Code Execution when a specially crafted series of requests is sent by an authenticated user. This is due to insufficient validation of artifacts.

item.title: CVE-2023-42509|2024-08-02T19:57:43.236Z -- jfrog -- artifactory
item.description: JFrog Artifactory later than version 7.17.4 but prior to version 7.77.0 is vulnerable to an issue whereby a sequence of improperly handled exceptions in repository configuration initialization steps may lead to exposure of sensitive data.

item.title: CVE-2023-42662|2024-08-02T20:00:35.991Z -- jfrog -- artifactory
item.description: JFrog Artifactory versions 7.59 and above, but below 7.59.18, 7.63.18, 7.68.19, 7.71.8 are vulnerable to an issue whereby user interaction with specially crafted URLs could lead to exposure of user access tokens due to improper handling of the CLI / IDE browser based SSO integration.
